_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.1 Company's has coordinated our Risk Management Plan with theLEPC.

1.2 The facility manufactures polyurethane foam by the vigorous mechanical mixing of polyols with TDI
      along with water, catalyst and surfactant.  The resultant polymeric network is expanded with carbon
      dioxide formed in the reaction between the water and TDI.
      Our ficility stores and uses quantities of toluene diisocyanate in excess of the threshold quantities
      specified in the 40 CFR 68.115.
     
      The TDI is stored as follows:

      Three 6,300  gallon TDI storage tanks (see Section 1.3 for worst-case release)

      TDI is pumped from the storage tanks to the production line where it is mixed with other chemicals and
      reacts to form polyurethane foam.

1.3  Description of worst-case release

       The worst-case release analyzed was the loss of the entire contents of a 6,300 gallon TDI tank  into
        3,720 sq. ft. (120 ft. x 34 ft.) diked containment area.  It also assumes a maximum ambient temperature
        (record 5 year high) of 105 degrees fahrenheit and a TDI temperature in the storage tank of 100
        degrees fahrenheit.  It also assumes ''ground roughness" to be "urban or forest".  The print-out shows
        the distance to end point to be 28 yards.  Also all storage tanks are inside the building.

1.4  Description of general prevention program

        None required by this program.
    
        The action taken at our facility to prevent accidental release includes the following:
        
        Periodic inspection of all lines, pumps,.  Valves for leaks.  corrosion.  Operational failure.

       Manual inspection of tank levels prior to loading to ensure adequate space is available.

        Unloading operations are not left unattened.

        Dual lined hoases for transport of TDI.

        Storage tanks are indoors to reduce corrosion and protect from accidental rupture.

         Storage tanks are all diked with concrete .

1.5    Descr

iption of the Accident History

          There have been no accidental releases of TDI from our facility in the past 5 years that have       
         caused on-site or off-site impacts.

1.6    Description of the Emergency Response Program:    


        None required.  The local LEPC has been informed of the dangers associated with TDI and has been 
        provided with sufficient information to enable them to deal with a release incident.
